senses.de: A set of instructions that tell a computer what to do
senses.ex: Microsoft Word is application software which is a type of software used for creating documents.

Tips.title: Not Physical
Tips.description: Software refers to intangible computer instructions, unlike hardware that you can touch.
Tips.example: I downloaded new software for my computer, not a physical device.

Tips.title: Ever-evolving
Tips.description: Software is regularly updated to fix bugs or add features, unlike static physical objects.
Tips.example: My antivirus software requires a yearly update to stay effective.

Tips.title: Variety of Uses
Tips.description: Software can perform a wide range of tasks, from simple calculations to complex data analysis.
Tips.example: Voice recognition software transcribes speech into written text.

senses.de: A set of related programs designed to be used by a specific industry or occupation
senses.ex: Companies use specialized business software to keep track of their finances.

Tips.title: Industry-Specific
Tips.description: Specialized software is tailored to specific job tasks, making them more efficient.
Tips.example: Accountants use specialized software to manage tax filings.

Tips.title: Not Interchangeable
Tips.description: Software designed for one industry may not be useful or appropriate for another.
Tips.example: Dental clinic software won't be useful for a construction company.

Tips.title: Integrates with Workflows
Tips.description: Industry software often integrates with existing processes to streamline work.
Tips.example: Our restaurant software integrates with the point of sale system.

Algorithm.wordDefinition:
An algorithm is a set of instructions or steps used to solve a problem or complete a task.

Algorithms can be used to solve math problems, sort data, or even help robots walk.

Software refers to the programs and applications that are written using algorithms. Software is essentially the end result of using algorithms to create a product that can be used on a computer or other device.

So, while algorithms are the building blocks used to create software, software is the tangible product that can be used by people.

Algorithms are applicable in a wide range of fields, from mathematics and engineering to computer science and robotics.

Application.wordDefinition:
Application refers to a program or software that performs a specific task or function, while software refers to a set of programs, data, and instructions that control the operation of a computer.

For example, Microsoft Word is an application that is used for word processing, while Microsoft Office is a software suite that includes Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

Applications are typically used for specific tasks such as editing photos, browsing the internet, or playing games. They are designed to be user-friendly and provide a simple interface for users to interact with.

In summary, applications are specific programs for performing tasks, while software includes all the programs and tools necessary for a computer to function.

Code.wordDefinition:
Code refers to the instructions that a programmer writes in order to tell a computer what to do. It is the language used to create software.

Software is the complete package that includes code as well as any other necessary files, documentation, and interfaces.

Code is like a recipe, while software is the finished dish. Code is used by programmers to create software, and it is constantly being tweaked and improved upon.

Code is the language used to create software, while software is the complete package that includes the code along with other necessary files to make it usable for the end user.

Platform.wordDefinition:
A platform is a foundation or structure on which something can be built or developed, while software is a program or set of instructions that tells a computer what to do.

Platforms are generally used to provide a base on which software can run or be developed. They may provide features like a user interface, tools for developers, or integration with other programs.

Examples of platforms include operating systems (such as Windows or iOS), game consoles, social media websites (such as Facebook or Instagram), and ecommerce marketplaces (such as Amazon or Etsy).

Software is the specific program or application that is run on a platform.

Software can be created to run on different platforms, or can be specific to one platform.

A platform is a base or structure on which software can be built, while software is a specific program or application that is run on a platform.

Programme.wordDefinition:
Programme and software are often used interchangeably, but there is a subtle difference between the two.

Programme generally refers to a set of instructions or a plan of action that is designed to accomplish a certain task.

It can refer to a television programme, an exercise programme, or a business programme, and it is typically used in a broader sense than software.

Software specifically refers to the electronic programs that run on a computer or other device. It is a set of instructions or programs that allow the computer to perform specific tasks, such as word processing, data analysis, or internet browsing.

Programme is a more general term that can refer to a wide range of plans or instructions, while software is a more specific term that refers specifically to electronic programs.

System.wordDefinition:
System refers to a collection of hardware, software, and other components that work together to perform a specific function.

Examples of systems include operating systems like Windows or MacOS, gaming consoles like Xbox or PlayStation, and navigation systems in vehicles.

In simpler terms, software is a single program that runs on a device, while a system is a combination of hardware and software components that work together to perform a specific task.

Tool.wordDefinition:
A tool is a physical or digital device that is designed to perform specific actions or tasks. It is something you can use to accomplish a goal or solve a problem.

Examples of tools include hammers, saws, screwdrivers, and pliers.

Software is a set of digital instructions that tell a computer what to do, whereas a tool is a physical or digital device that you use to complete a task.

Software can be used for a wide range of tasks, from editing photos to managing finances, while tools are typically more specific, such as a hammer for nailing things or a screwdriver for tightening screws.

Utility.wordDefinition:
Utility refers specifically to software tools that perform specific tasks to optimize or enhance the performance of a computer system.

For example, a disk cleanup utility might help clear unnecessary files from a hard drive, or a firewall utility might protect a computer from online threats.

Software is a broad term that encompasses all kinds of computer programs, while utilities refer specifically to tools that improve the functioning of a computer system.

quotes.Text: Human beings either function as individuals or as members of a pack. There's a switch inside us, deep in our spirit, that you can turn one way or the other. It's almost always the case that our worst behaviour comes out when we're switched to the mob setting. The problem with a lot of software designs is that they switch us to that setting.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Jaron Lanier

quotes.Text: Many people think that being a graphic designer means going to an expensive art school and buying expensive software that will cost you thousands of dollars. This is so far from the truth. There are hundreds of online education centers that offer top-notch graphic design training.
quotes.Title: Ecuadorian Politician
quotes.Name: Fabrizio Moreira

quotes.Text: You really need to have a lot of empathy for the work you're doing and the people who you're ultimately trying to help, whether that's a business colleague, a boss, or, ultimately, the user of the software you're building.

quotes.Text: In short, software is eating the world.
